revised_title: Quantum-Chemical Modeling of Catalytic Reactivity in Transition Metals
tldr: The article discusses the use of computational quantum-chemical methods to model catalytically active sites and predict reaction paths of elementary reaction steps on transition metal surfaces. The authors review the electronic factors that control chemisorption of molecules and atoms on transition-metal surfaces, and illustrate their findings with examples of CO dissociation, carbon-carbon coupling, and oxidation.
